speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: SCENE III. The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.

speaker: GRATIANO
text_entry: Enter JESSICA and LAUNCELOT

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: I am sorry thou wilt leave my father so:

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: Our house is hell, and thou, a merry devil,

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: Didst rob it of some taste of tediousness.

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: But fare thee well, there is a ducat for thee:

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: And, Launcelot, soon at supper shalt thou see

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: Lorenzo, who is thy new master's guest:

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: Give him this letter; do it secretly;

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: And so farewell: I would not have my father

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: See me in talk with thee.

speaker: LAUNCELOT
text_entry: Adieu! tears exhibit my tongue. Most beautiful

speaker: LAUNCELOT
text_entry: pagan, most sweet Jew! if a Christian did not play

speaker: LAUNCELOT
text_entry: the knave and get thee, I am much deceived. But,

speaker: LAUNCELOT
text_entry: adieu: these foolish drops do something drown my

speaker: LAUNCELOT
text_entry: manly spirit: adieu.

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: Farewell, good Launcelot.

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: Exit Launcelot

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: Alack, what heinous sin is it in me

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: To be ashamed to be my father's child!

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: But though I am a daughter to his blood,

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: I am not to his manners. O Lorenzo,

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: If thou keep promise, I shall end this strife,

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: Become a Christian and thy loving wife.

speaker: JESSICA
text_entry: Exit
